required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Dental Implant Placement in the Sloped Alveolar Ridge
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Dental Implant Placement in the Sloped Alveolar Ridge

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study was to investigate the therapeutic effect of sloped dental implants. It can reduce the need of osteoectomy, reduce discomfort of procedures, and is easier for maintenance.

detailed_description.textblock:
20 OsseoSpeed ™ Profile EV and 20 OsseoSpeed ™ EV groups will be randomly implanted into the oblique edentulous ridges of subjects, and the treatment response will be monitored for 3 years. The implantation area will be randomly divided into two groups, One group was treated with OsseoSpeed ™ Profile EV (sloped group) and the other group was treated with OsseoSpeed ™ EV (control group). The same patient had the same implant as the same quadrant.
The patient will be followed up regularly for follow-up, followed by clinical attachment level, probing depth, bleeding on probing, keratinized gingival width (Keratinized gingiva), mobility (mobility) and other clinical indicators of the measurement, regular dental radiography, gingival crevicular fluid (GCF) collection and bone integration measurement.
After six months of implantation, prosthesis will delivered and loaded functionally, and regular follow-up will be arranged. In each time of follow-up, examination will be carried out with regards to periodontal pocket depth, clinical attachment height, periodontal bleeding index, keratinized gingival width, and other clinical indicators of the measurement, at the end of the experiment, that is, after three years, and then a dental root film irradiation, GCF collection and osseointegration measurement.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical assessment of the status of osseointegration
primary_outcome.description: radiographic bone level, bone consolidation index (ISQ)

secondary_outcome.measure: The health status of adjacent teeth
secondary_outcome.description: radiographic bone level, clinical attachment level, pocket depth, periodontal bleeding (bleeding on probing), keratinized gingival width (masticatory mucosa width)
radiographic bone level, clinical attachment level, pocket depth, periodontal bleeding (bleeding on probing), keratinized gingival width (masticatory mucosa width)

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomarkers in the gingival crevicular fluid of adjacent teeth
secondary_outcome.description: Inflammatory markers such as Interleukin-1 beta, matrix metalloproteinase-8, Interleukin-8, or Interleukin-10

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomarkers in the gingival crevicular fluid of dental implant
secondary_outcome.description: Inflammatory markers such as Interleukin-1 beta, matrix metalloproteinase-8, Interleukin-8, or Interleukin-10

arm_group.description: Installation of conventional design dental implant
Installation of sloped design dental implant

intervention.description: Placement of implant with sloped design
Placement of implant with conventional design

criteria.textblock: 20-80 years old with appropriate oral cleaning ability; the computer tomography shows > 1 mm buccolingual discrepancy of alveolar ridge height; no generalized periodontitis, or had history of periodontitis but has been completed treatment; no major systemic infection or major systemic illness; not taken antibiotics in the past two weeks Not pregnant or breastfeeding
